Respect in National Reserves and Parks • Parks: protected areas. Frequent rules: stay on the trails, do not pick anything, no fire, dogs prohibited (even on a leash), drones prohibited unless authorized. Respect on-site signs and local orders. • Nature reserves & regional parks: variable rules (bivouac, dogs, fires). Check for seasonal quietness areas and signage.
Why not bathe in high-altitude lakes • Fragile ecosystems: many lakes are oligotrophic and very sensitive; small disturbances have great effects. • Pollutants: sunscreen/body products, textile fibres and micro-organisms degrade water and plankton; focus on managed bathing areas. • Wildlife disturbance: amphibians and shorebirds are sensitive to noise, trampling and clapp (plants, spawning grounds). • Health/safety: very cold water (thermal shock/hypothermia), slippery banks; Some municipalities prohibit bathing by decree. • Simple rule: if a ban is displayed, you do not bathe; Otherwise, observe without entering the water, leave nothing, avoid prolonged contact.
Good practices in protected areas • Stay on the trails to limit erosion. • Bivouac: often tolerated overnight (after 7pm – before 9am), away from roads/houses; remain > 20 m from lakes/water courses; leave with grey water and waste. • Dogs: usually forbidden in park hearts; keep on a leash and respect periods of tranquillity. • Drones: assimilated to motorized and prohibited aircraft in park cores (rare exceptions on authorization). • Wildlife & herds: do not continue; make a wide detour; Close the fences.
Marking: color codes - GR: white/red; // = straight; angle = turn; Cross = wrong path. GRP: yellow/red; territory loops. PR: yellow; local/day loops.
